"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> Sounds like you're suggesting a "reset" button, so add one... :)
>
> public class MySingleton {
>     ...
>     public static void reset() {
>         instance = null;    // ...or whatever else you need to do.
>     }
>     ...
> }
>

Indeed, that would be the better approach, and probably the most obvious outcome of a test-first session.

I thought the OP indicated that the singleton was in a third-party library, but I could be wrong.

Regards,
